[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [State] [Initialized Flag] State.Initialized is checked once at line 18 then set at line 38 - could the contract be called between initialization steps? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Token Economics] [Resource Token Oversupply] Each resource token gets 500M total supply (line 88) and all are issued to TokenConverter - could this flood the market? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Token Economics] [Election Token Concentration] 1B VOTE and 1B SHARE tokens all issued to one contract (line 132) - is this single point of control a security risk? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Token Economics] [Decimals Inconsistency] Native token decimals are configurable (line 59), resource tokens use 8 decimals (line 89), election tokens use 8 decimals (line 122) - could mismatches break conversions? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Token Economics] [Burnable Tokens] Native token burnable status is configurable (line 60), but resource and election tokens are always burnable - could selective burning break economic balance? (Medium)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Context] [Variables Manipulation] Context.Variables.NativeSymbol, GetStringArray, etc. are used throughout - could manipulating these variables before initialization corrupt the entire economic system? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Context] [Self Reference] Context.Self is used as Issuer and Owner for all tokens - could Context.Self be different in different execution contexts? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [Context] [Contract Name Resolution] GetContractAddressByName is called repeatedly - could contract name collisions or front-running during deployment cause wrong addresses? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [External] [TokenContract Trust] All token operations are delegated to State.TokenContract - if TokenContract has vulnerabilities, does EconomicContract inherit them? (Critical)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [External] [Cross-Contract Call Failures] Multiple Send operations to external contracts - if any fail silently without reverting, could initialization complete in invalid state? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [External] [TokenConverter Dependency] TokenConverter initialization at line 254 happens after tokens are issued to it - could tokens be trapped if initialization fails? (High)

[File: contract/AElf.Contracts.Economic/EconomicContract.cs] [External] [ElectionContract Trust] Election tokens and voting events depend on ElectionContract - if compromised, could entire voting system be corrupted? (Critical)
